Window plugin base class.

Class that represents polygon mesh vertices.

Plugins can use Shade's internal shading calculation routines via texture_interface.

Stream for reading and writing to a text file.

Used to set, get surface attributes.

Gets a string from the text resource.

Used to read, write files and attribute streams.

Used to set, get the skin info.

Used to set, get the info and weight of the joint bound to the skin.

Used to set, get shortcuts.

Interface for accessing path_replicators.

Interface for accessing switch effectors.

sound track

Retains geometric data of objects for undo support.

Interface for accessing custom joints.

Interface for accessing ball joints.

Interface for accessing rotator joints.

Class that handles disks.

Class that handles lights.

Class that handles image object.

Class that handles master surfaces.

Class that handles master shape object.

Class that handles parts.

Class that handles sentinel objects, which represent the terminus of parts.

Base class for handling operations common to all shapes.

Use to start, set rendering.

Browser plug-in base class.

Gets or sets the background info.

Custom attribute plug-in base class.

Implement the custom attribute plug-in by defining the custom attribute class derived from attribute_interface

The custom attribute plug-in can be run from the Browser, Camera, Distant Light, Surface, and Surface Mapping pop-up menu in addition to the Custom Info menu by overriding accepts-type functions.

Use this class for implementing functions that add custom information for the plug-in to the Object, Camera, Distant Light, Surface, or Surface Mapping.

Use stream_interface for assigning custom attribute information. Assigned custom information can be accessed from that plug-in or from a different plug-in.

Also, by assigning attributes to an object, wireframe drawing can be done with make_wireframe(), or a ray intersection calculation can be customized with ray_intersection().

Gets the background mapping layer info, and gets the background_layer_class reference with background_layer() to set the info.

Get this class directly with the function below.

scene_interface::get_background_interface()

Background settings are composed of at least 1 layer, and background_layer represents one of those layers.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as an argument by another function.

background_interface::background_layer()

By defining a browser_interface derived class you can implement Browser plug-ins.

Browser plug-ins are run by selecting them from the Browser context menu.

Multiple cameras can be definied in the scene; however camera_class represents one camera.

The following function gets this class directly. This class my also be passed as an argument by another function.

scene_interface::get_camera()

Multiple cameras can be set in the scene, but camera_interface represents one camera.

When getting the camera info from scene_interface, camera_class, which has no overhead from generated objects, is recommended.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

scene_interface::get_camera_interface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::get_color_interface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::get_color_list_interface()

Line objects are composed of at least 1 control point, and control_point_class represents one of those control points.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::control_point()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

By deriving creator_interface and defining a custom attribute class, you can implement a creator plug-in.

Creator plug-ins are started from the Create or Part menus and wiat for a click or drag action in the Figure window.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::get_critical_section_interface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

dialog_interface::get_dialog_item()

The constructor creates a dialog box with the UUID number specified with the argument (0 when omitted).

By specifying the SXUL resource with set_resource_name(), you can create an interface listed in the SXUL.

By setting plugin_interface as the responder, you can do a callback for dialog actions with the following functions.

plugin_interface::initialize_dialog(), plugin_interface::respond(), plugin_interface::load_dialog_data(), plugin_interface::save_dialog_data(), plugin_interface::terminate()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::create_dialog_interface_with_uuid()

Each property has its own value type and name, and you can set/get this value.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

scene_interface::get_display_interface()

To get/set the info for each Distant Light, get the distant_light_item_class reference from distant_light_item().

Distant Light settings are composed of at least 1 distant light, and distant_light_item_class represents one of those distant light items.

The following function is used to get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

distant_light_interface::distant_light_item()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function arugment.

Implement effector plug-ins by defining effector_interface derived classes.

Typically, a callback function is called after the rendering calculation, and the operation is done on the renderingn image within that callback function.

Implement the exporter plug-in by defining an exporter_interface derived class. The exporter plug-in is for exporting Shade objects to other 3D file formats.

The exporter plug-in is run from the Export menu.

scene_interface::get_speed_interface().get_expression_interface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

polygon_mesh_class::face()

Implement Figure window plug-ins by defining a figure_interface derived class.

The Figure window plugin is run from the Figure window context menu.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

scene_interface::get_fog_interface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

image_interface::get_graphic_context_interface()

Implement the Image box plug-in by defining a image_box_interface derived class.

The Image box plug-in is run from the Image box context menu.

Implement the image exporter plugin by defining an image_exporter_interface derived class.

The image exporter plugin allows you to add image formats that Shade can save.

Implement this plugin by defining an image_importer_interface derived class.

The image importer plugin allows you to add image formats that Shade can import.

Shade 7 and earlier had both 32 bit (8 bits per channel) and 128 bit (32 bits per channel) real color images, but Shade 8 has combined these into one image format.

Image color depths of 32, 64, and 128 bits are supported. (Set in the Rendering Settings for rendered images, and by the file format for image files.)

As such, the plugin can set/get image info without worrying about the image color depth.

64 and 128 bit images support HDRI and can hold a brightness value greater than 1.0. Because converting the color value from the image to an integer can cause overflow and precision errors, floating point values are recommended for most cases.

sxsdk::rgb_class and rgba_class which use floating point values for the color are used in the following functions. Because 32 bit images can also be used it is not necessary to switch the function according to the color depth.

set_real_color(), get_real_color(), set_real_colors(), get_real_colors(), set_pixel_rgba_float(), get_pixel_rgba_float(), set_pixels_rgba_float(), get_pixels_rgba_float()

The following functions get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::create_image_interface(), shade_interface::create_image_interface_from_file()

Implement the importer plugin by defining an importer_interface derived class.

The importer plugin is run from the Import menu.

The following functions get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

Passed as a callback argument with exporter_interface and renderer_interface.

Handles only meshes with complete lattice structures. Has distance UV and parameter UV values. Only the sides of extruded solids are passed with this class.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::create_converted_meshes_interface()

Passed as a callback argument with exporter_interface and renderer interface.

Shade curved surfaces are not compatible with general Bezier curves. This class handles Bezier curves converted from curved surfaces, spheres, extruded solids, and revolved solids. Only the sides of extruded solids are passed with this class.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

part_class::create_control_mesh_interface()

Passed as an argument of exporter_interface::do_export().

All base classes for implementing other types of plugins are derived from plugin_interface.

Implement the renderer plugin by defining a renderer_interface derived class.

The renderer plugin is added to the Method pop-up menu in the Rendering settings.

The same callback as the exporter plugin can be used to get objects during rendering since it is derived from exporter_interface. (To call a callback, call rendering_context_interface::convert() in render().)

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

scene_interface::rendering_interface()

The rendering context contains all the information regarding light sources including distance light, point light, spot light and distribution light in a table.

Plugin should use those information rather than accessing light source information in the scene which may be changed while rendering.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

rendering_context_interface::get_light()

The following functions gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::get_scene_interface(), stream_interface::get_scene_interface(), surface_interface::get_scene_interface(), sxsdk::shape_class::get_scene_interface(), shape_interface::get_scene_interface(), plugin_exporter_interface::get_scene_interface(), rendering_context_interface::get_scene_interface()

Implement the shader plugin by defining a shader_interface derived class.

The shader plugin is added to the surface attributes mapping patterns.

Non-implemented class. Will be used as a mapping_layer_class expansion in the next updater.

To get/set the particular info for each type of shape, use this class to determine the shape type and then get each particular class.

The following functions get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

scene_interface::active_shape(), scene_interface::get_shape()

The sentinel object represents the terminus of a part, and exists for all parts (even empty parts).

The sentinel object's bro is the topmost object in the part, and the sis is the bottom-most object in the part.

Returns false with has_bro(), has_sis(), and has_son() if the object to confirm is a sentinel.

Because sentinel_class is used internally, it is not returned from the plug-in side.

Gets/sets part info.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::get_part()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::set_master_surface(), sxsdk::shape_class::get_master_surface()

sxsdk::shape_class::get_disk()

Since an object being rendered cannot always be specified from those in the regular shape object tree in a scene, special tree with proxy shapes is created while rendering.

Proxy shape's dad, son, sis, bro are always proxy shapes (if not nil).

The following functions get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

rendeing_context_interface::get_current_proxy_shape(), rendering_context_interface::get_root_proxy_shape()

sxsdk::shape_class::get_ball_joint_interface()

Custom joints only have a value, and unlike other joints to not affect child objects. Used as an interface to change the plug-in settings or to create independent joints with a callback function.

Custom joint settings are stored as part of the object attributes, but to make it easy to access from plug-ins and scripts the settings can be get/set from a separate interface.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::get_custom_joint_interface()

An undo task unit (executed when selected by the user from the Undo menu) comprises one or more registered undo actions.

Geometric state of the original shape object is saved to a shape_saver_interface object when it is created.

A plugin must register actions that revert the geometric state of objects to the previous one (and back to the current state) as an undo action. After the geometry state is saved to the shape_saver_interface object, you modify the original shape object, then you must call set_undo_action() function to register the undo action.

See the simple_undo target of the SDK sample project for how to use shape_saver_interface.

blah

For each type of shape object, the following geometric attributes are stored. Future versions of Shade may store attributes other then listed here, and older version may not store all of these.

Polygon mesh Object(polygon_mesh_class)

Vertex coordinates, faces, edges, roundness, threshold, smooth flag, show edge flag

blah

Line Object (line_class)

Control points that comprise the line object.

blah

Part Object (part_class)

(Assuming that the part object is a curved surface) control points that compirse the curved surface.

blah

Light Object (light_class)

Intensity, location, rotation, half_angle, softness, shadow, shadow_softness, specular, diffuse, attenuation.

blah

Sphere Object (sphere_class)

A transformation matrix that defines the sphere.

blah

Disk Object (sphere_class)

A transformation matrix that defines the disk.

Switch joint settings are stored as part of the object attributes, but to make it easy to access from plug-ins and scripts the settings can be get/set from a separate interface.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

The attribute stream is an area of memory of data used by the plugin, and can be attached to Shade objects. Use stream_interface to access the attribute stream, reading and writing to it just like to/from a file.

The following functions get this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

create_attribute_stream_interface_with_uuid(), get_attribute_stream_interface_with_uuid() of surface_interface, surface_class, sxsdk::shape_class, shader_node_class, scene_interface, rendering_interface, preference_interface, mapping_layer_class, distant_light_item_class, camera_class

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

shade_interface::create_strings_interface()

Allows you to access surface attributes without overhead of creating/deleting interface objects.

surface_class::get_xxx() functions returns surface_class's member variable whether the attribute is set to inherit from an ancestor or not while surface_interface::get_xxx() functions searches for an ancestor and returns its value.

surface_class::find_xxx() functions searches for an ancestor and returns its value.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be passed as a function argument.

sxsdk::shape_class::get_surface()

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be called as a function argument.

plugin_exporter_interface::get_text_stream_interface, shade_interface::create_text_file_interface()

texture_interface maintains its internal states and does shading calculation using those states.

A typical usege from a plugin is to create a texture_interface object, then to repeat setting up the internal states, calling update() then fetching the results.

Polygon meshes have at least one vertex, and vertex_class represents one of those vertices.

The following function gets this class directly. It may also be called as a function argument.

polygon_mesh_class::vertex()

Implement the window plugin by defining a window_interface derived class.
